body_html:
@dr4b The rendering is indeed identical in the online previewer. The problem is that the syntax is actually invalid. Although most LaTeX systems do manage to cope with this syntax, biber (a more recent latex bibliography tool) seems to have issues with this invalid syntax.

I provided the online latex previewer in order to test the equivalence (i.e. that both work). In order to reproduce the bug, you would have to have a full latex system running on your machine and use biber for managing the bibliography. You should use the MWE from this question at texexchange to reproduce the bug.

You should use the MWE from this question at texexchange to reproduce the bug.
body:
@dr4b The rendering is indeed identical in the online previewer. The problem is that the syntax is actually invalid. Although most LaTeX systems do manage to cope with this syntax, biber (a more recent latex bibliography tool) seems to have issues with this invalid syntax.

I provided the online latex previewer in order to test the equivalence (i.e. that both work). In order to reproduce the bug, you would have to have a full latex system running on your machine and use biber for managing the bibliography. You should use the MWE from [this question at texexchange](https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/23817/biber-writes-incorrect-unicode-encoding-of-i) to reproduce the bug.
